研究：每天多走15分鐘 可帶動經濟成長
06 Nov 2019, 16:19 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社倫敦6日綜合外電報導）一項研究結果顯示，若雇主成功鼓勵員工做到世界衛生組織（WHO）建議的運動指導方針，就可促進世界經濟，一年規模達1000億美元之多。
路透社報導，英國「活力」健康保險集團（Vitality）及智庫「蘭德歐洲」（RAND Europe）研究發現，每天多步行15分鐘，或每天固定慢跑一公里，或許可以改善生產力及延長預期壽命，也就能帶動經濟成長。
這項研究的作者表示，經濟成長的動能主要來自死亡率降低，也就是活著的人口更多，能勞動、對經濟有貢獻的時間更長，員工請病假的天數也更少。
「蘭德歐洲」主席龐恩（Hans Pung）說，這項研究凸顯「不運動與生產力降低之間的顯著關聯」，應能給予決策者及雇主有關如何提升人民及員工生產力的新觀點。
世界衛生組織建議成人每週應至少做150分鐘中度運動或75分鐘劇烈運動。去年一項研究發現，約40%的美國成人、36%的英國成人、14%的中國成人所做的運動不足以保持健康。
「活力」健康保險集團及「蘭德歐洲」的研究有部分以來自7國、約12萬人的數據為基礎，然後為全球及23個單一國家建立模型，預測增加體能活動帶來的潛在經濟利益。
研究結果發現，若所有18歲到64歲成人每天多走15分鐘，就可能在一年期的比較中增加約1000億美元的全球經濟產出。
研究還發現，不運動的40歲成人每天若慢跑20分鐘，平均可增加3.2歲的預期壽命。（譯者：曾依璇/核稿：劉淑琴）1081106

Research: 15 minutes more every day can drive economic growth
06 Nov 2019, 16:19 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
(Central News Agency, London, 6th, comprehensive foreign news report) A study shows that if employers successfully encourage employees to implement the World Health Organization (WHO) recommended sports guidelines, they can promote the world economy, with a total annual income of 100 billion US dollars.
Reuters reported that the British "Vitality" Health Insurance Group (Vitality) and the think tank "RAND Europe" found that walking 15 minutes a day, or a one-kilometer per day, may improve productivity and extend life expectancy. It can also drive economic growth.
The authors of the study said that the kinetic energy of economic growth is mainly due to lower mortality, that is, more people living, more labor, more time to contribute to the economy, and fewer days for employees to take sick leave.
Hans Pung, chairman of Rand Europe, said the study highlights the "significant link between no movement and reduced productivity" and should give decision makers and employers new ideas on how to improve the productivity of people and employees.
The World Health Organization recommends that adults should have at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous exercise per week. A study last year found that about 40% of American adults, 36% of British adults, and 14% of Chinese adults did not exercise enough to stay healthy.
Some of the research on the "Vibrant Health Insurance Group" and "Rand Europe" are based on data from 7 countries and about 120,000 people, and then model the global and 23 single countries to predict the potential economy brought about by increased physical activity. interest.
The study found that if all adults between the ages of 18 and 64 walk 15 minutes a day, it is possible to add about $100 billion in global economic output over a one-year comparison.
The study also found that non-exercise 40-year-old adults who jog for 20 minutes a day can increase their life expectancy by an average of 3.2 years. (Translator: Zeng Yijun / Approved: Liu Shuqin) 1081106
